newsitem.title: ESTONIA: PRO MED CONSIDERS SHARE ISSUE, LISTING.
newsitem.headline: PRO MED CONSIDERS SHARE ISSUE, LISTING.

text.p: Hansa Investments said that Pro Med, the largest pharmaceuticals distribution and wholesale company in Estonia, is considering a public share issue and bourse listing this year.
"They are planning a public share issue and listing on the stock exchange in summer this year," Kristal Trumm of Hansa Investments, told Reuters.
Neither a concrete timing for the issue nor other details have yet been finalised, Trumm added.
She said the company was the largest drug distributor in Estonia but also had operations in Latvia and Lithuania. She said the group was also planning more regional expansion.
The company has existed for several years and became the largest distributor when it bought the state-owned drugs distributor.
Trumm expected good interest if the share issue goes ahead and that the firm had "huge potential".
